p.s: The given newspaper article Language learning in the UK: can't, won't, don't written by John Worne was published in The Telegraph on January 27, 2015 and deals with the foreign language learning in the UK as an issue.
In John Worne's is important for globalisation, because language is the key for the UK's future prosperity and global standing.
It is essential on a daily basis and a very attractive combination for employers if you speak more than just one language and not just English.

He exclaims the issue of foreign language learning in the UK Worne stresses out that the number of UK students choosing to study a foreign langauge at univertyuniversity levels has been decreased and he claims that there were 10.000 fewer language A-Level exams taken than in the 1990s.
His personal view on the issue is that school and education system alone can notcannot fix it and that it needs help from the parents of the UK to spread awareness of the problem at home.
They have to start to think more about international experiences and foreign languages.
